title: Pair Swap is Involutive
description:
Prove that swapping a pair twice gives back the original pair.

**Goal:** `forall (A B : Type) (p : A * B), swap_pair (swap_pair p) = p`

The `swap_pair` function exchanges the two components of a pair. This proof introduces working with product types and `destruct` on pairs.
hints: Use `destruct p as [a b]` to decompose the pair into its two components
After destructing, `simpl` will unfold both applications of `swap_pair`, and the result is immediate
prelude:
Definition swap_pair {A B : Type} (p : A * B) : B * A :=
  match p with
  | (a, b) => (b, a)
  end.
template:

  swap_pair (swap_pair p) = p.

solution:
Theorem swap_pair_involutive : forall (A B : Type) (p : A * B),
  swap_pair (swap_pair p) = p.
Proof.
  intros A B p.
  destruct p as [a b].
  simpl. reflexivity.
Qed.
